1.2 Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WP
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS, WP
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Current Excavation Permit signed and specific for the area where works will be executed.
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Document review & Site inspection
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All services have been located with a service locator and proven through NDD, signing the excavation permit as required.
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Document review & Site inspection
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Excavation Permit #, ITP Signed
2.1 Conduit and Pit installation and backfilling
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Conduit installation will be completed under:
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed

– Care must be taken during excavations to prevent soil blocking drains or causing an obstruction on roads or paths. Roads and paths shall be made good to the satisfaction of the V/Line delegated representative.
– Unless noted otherwise pole foundation to be bored pile provided in accordance with the pole manufacturers instructions.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed

– Underground installations require a pit to be installed adjacent to each lighting pole with 1 x 100mm HD conduit and 1 x 63mm conduit installed between pit and the point of supply. 2 x 32mm HD conduits are to be installed between the pit and the pole mounting base. The installation of pits is not required if junction boxes are used beneath an accessible platform surface.

– Should the supply cable not include an earth conductor or a separate earth cable is not run, then an earth copper stake is to be installed at the base of the pole and this earth stake shall be bonded to both pole steel reinforcement and supply neutral.
– All lighting poles to have a 6A Terasaki or approved equivalent (MCB) (C) installed at the base of the pole to enable seperate isolations.
3.3 Installation of frangible poles (Slip base and Impact Absorbing)
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The final design of the location and spacing of the light poles is to be confirmed with the V/Line Asset Management Department or delegated representative.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Visual Inspection/Test Certificates, This ITP signed
– Only LED lighting shall be installed and the fitting constructed in such a way that insects and dust cannot enter the light fitting.
– Every luminaire installed shall be equipped with the appropriate lamp of the rating specified or where not specified, in accordance with the highest nominal maximum rating of the luminaire.
– All luminaires being maintained shall be cleaned and re-lamped, checked for operation and provide with new starters where applicable.
– Lamps, luminaires, and poles shall be of a type specified on drawings.

– The number and size of distribution boards shall be based on the requirements to localise faults, reduce wiring runs, and minimise overall cost of installation and maintenance. The installation shall allow for spare capacity of not less than 30%, shall be accessible for future upgrading and maintenance and be constructed in a manner to minimise vandalism.

– The design shall indicate the method of installation to be used. Under track crossings shall comply with the Railways of Australia (ROA) Code, or Victorian Rail Track Corporation (VRTC) regulations.
– All electrical cabling to be in accordance with the requirements of AS/NZS 3000: (Australian/New Zealand Wiring Rules)
– Each pole to be cables from the pole circuit breaker
– All cables shall be terminated in an appropriate termination panel within the base of the pole.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings and drawing registers
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Test Certification, This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All distribution boards shall be identified by a systematic number. Each switchboard is to have a label attached to indicate its point of supply and the supply circuit.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
